container-title: Journal of Clinical Psychology: In Session
note: The authors update the reader on professional literature regarding rural practice and share clinical challenges.
title: Opportunities and challenges of rural practice: Managing self amid ambiguity

note: Dr. Gabbard talks about the slippery slope leading to sexual boundary violations.
title: Lessons to be learned from the study of sexual boundary violations
Multiple relationships encountered by lesbian and bisexual psychotherapists: How close is too close?
Therapist self-disclosure: Research-based suggestions for practitioners
Knox and Hill provide a thorough discussion of psychotherapist self-disclosure with recommendations to maximize therapeutic effectiveness
Pregnancy of the early-career psychiatrist
Although targeted at psychiatrists, Tinsley’s article provides a useful review of the literature on the pregnant psychotherapist and helpful suggestions for coping
A
Handbook of counseling and psychotherapy with lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender clients

Many contributors to this edited volume provide enhanced expertise and assist the psychotherapist in learning about cultural contexts and affirmative counseling with lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender clients

container-title: Devine’s now-classic article, she describes the process of automatic racial stereotype activation
Journal of Personality and Social Psychology
title: Stereotypes and prejudice: Their automatic and controlled components
Racism as a transference state: Episodes of racial hostility in the psychoanalytic context

Hamer’s discussion of how he, an African American psychotherapist, addressed clients’ racist remarks in therapy is well worth reading for psychotherapists of all racial backgrounds and provides invaluable insights into the psychodynamics of racism

note: Larson and Larson provide an informative and evenhanded review of the literature on spirituality and health; this is a good introduction to the topic.
title: Spirituality’s potential relevance to physical and emotional health: A brief review of quantitative research
The geography of thought: How Asians and Westerners think differently . . . and why
This fascinating work summarizes research describing cultural and cognitive differences, showing how people from different cultures actually see the world differently
Disguise or consent: Problems and recommendations concerning the publication and presentation of clinical material
This article provides a detailed discussion of the issues involved in presenting clinical material to colleagues while maintaining client confidentiality
Domestic violations of confidentiality
Woody describes a number of unfortunately common scenarios where confidentiality is violated by mental health practitioners

note: including those discussed in this chapter.
title: The paper office
This helpful and essential resource provides forms and helpful practice guidelines for many important clinical situations
Strategies to reduce misdiagnosis of bipolar depression
Bowden’s helpful and succinct article will aid you in more accurately diagnosing bipolar disorder when clients present with a depressive episode
Mental health issues for Asian Americans
This article provides helpful insights into culture and mental health of Asian Americans

note: Highly recommended for all mental health trainees and professionals.
title: Diagnosis made easier: Principles and techniques for mental health clinicians
This helpful and well-written volume clearly describes almost everything you will ever need to know about the process of making diagnoses

note: The authors provide helpful guidance for treating adults with ADHD.
title: Adapting psychotherapy to meet the needs of adults with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder
Winter blues: Seasonal affective disorder, what it is and how to overcome it
A definitive book about seasonal affective disorder—helpful for psychotherapists and clients alike
Learning to write case notes using the SOAP format
A short and helpful article about how to write appropriate progress notes

note: Despite its age, this classic article provides timeless, wise, and succinct advice about writing progress notes.
title: Paranoia and progress notes: A guide to forensically informed psychiatric record-keeping

Documenting psychotherapy: Essentials for mental health practitioners. Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage. The authors provide a thorough discussion of documentation issues, including why good documentation is essential, what belongs in a clinical record, documenting crises, and other topics

note: A brief but helpful volume on treating clients with insomnia. Gives especially helpful input regarding those who tend to ruminate at bedtime.
title: Overcoming insomnia: A cognitive-behavioral therapy approach

container-title: Journal of Urban Health: Bulletin of the New York Academy of Medicine
title: Social ties and mental health
This article provides a helpful overview of the relationship between socialization and mental health
Psychoeducation as evidence-based practice: Considerations for practice, research, and policy
This article provides a useful review of the evidence for psychoeducation as an effective treatment modality

note: books, films, groups, and the Internet) to further treatment.
title: Integrating self-help into psychotherapy: 16 practice suggestions
Norcross provides a helpful review of how mental health professionals and clients can use various modalities of self-help
Cognitive therapy: Basics and beyond
This book provides a helpful description of the therapeutic process in cognitive psychotherapy

note: Judith Beck extends the reach of cognitive psychotherapy in this helpful volume.
title: Cognitive therapy for challenging problems: What to do when the basics don’t work

Going to pieces without falling apart: A Buddhist perspective on wholeness. New York: Broadway Books. Eastern philosophy has made a powerful impact on the practice and theory of mental health in the past two decades. This very readable volume introduces important concepts
Long-term psychodynamic psychotherapy: A basic text

note: Careful review and consideration of the assessment process discussed in this article is recommended for all psychotherapists.
title: Assessing violence risk in Tarasoff situations: A factbased model of inquiry
Borum and Reddy discuss the process of evaluating an individual for immediate violence risk toward a specific individual
Management of the acutely violent patient
Petit thoroughly discusses the management of a client with acute risk of being immediately violent in the clinical setting
Patient violence against health care professionals: Safety assessment and management
psychiatrictimes.com/schizophrenia/content/article/10168/1813471# Simon shares cases of violence against mental health professionals and what we can learn from these cases
Elder abuse and neglect in medicine and law: The need for reform
Loue provides a detailed review of the area of elder abuse, including current legal complexities
Elder abuse and neglect: Considerations for mental health practitioners
Thompson and Priest provide helpful information, including how to assess the home situation, cultural considerations, and suggestions for intervention

note: Provides a detailed overview of the process of mandated reporting for elder abuse and neglect.
title: Mandated reporting of abuse/ maltreatment of older adults: A primer for counselors

note: Samuelson and Campbell assess current practices and give helpful recommendations for screening and intervention.
title: Screening for domestic violence: Recommendations based on a practice survey
The ubiquitous clinical problem of adult intimate partner violence: The need for routine assessment

The authors provide useful questions to assess the history and dangerousness of the IPV situation. The final appendix provides a useful handout that you can copy to give to clients for safety planning
Traumatic therapy: How helping rape victims affects me as a therapist
Astin powerfully describes the personal impact of working with rape victims and how she has learned to cope

container-title: In addition, talk to a lawyer about the difference between an expert witness and a witness of fact
title: Testifying in court: Guidelines and maxims for the expert witness

including this one, provide helpful and practical advice for any mental health professional (whether you are an expert witness or not) who has become embroiled in the legal system. If you are ever subpoenaed and you have to give testimony in court or give a deposition, read this first
If we are so rich, why aren’t we happy?
In this well-written article, Csikszentmihalyi summarizes much of the research on happiness, income, and flow and draws some profound conclusions about human existence and well-being

note: such as parentification, perfectionism, and the imposter phenomenon.
title: Narcissistic issues in therapists: Diagnostic and treatment considerations
Despite its off-putting title, this article is simply about gaining insight into common emotional issues among psychotherapists

note: A short classic volume to introduce the reader to basic meditation practices.
title: The miracle of mindfulness: A manual on meditation
Leaving it at the office: A guide to psychotherapist self-care

The authors discuss helpful issues for psychotherapists, such as nurturing relationships, setting boundaries, fostering creativity and growth, and others. Online Resource http://www.authentichappiness.sas.upenn.edu This is the website for the University of Pennsylvania Positive Psychology Center, which has numerous interesting resources regarding the psychological study of happiness
